content: Tomorrow I return to having 2  60 minute hyper baric oxygen sessions.............hoping to help anything connected to diabetes which hits the human body in every way possible. My feet are feeling really good now I think due to this medical procedure (which should be covered by insurance, but usually it is not), because I think my feet are actually healthier with improved circulation it's no wonder. And it also seems to last, I havent had this procedure for about 4 months now and if my feet remain as they are - I can live very comfortably without pain killers. I used to be very uncomfortable, I couldnt take a shower the water hitting my feet was unbearable, I had to wear socks at night, now I dont. The tingles and burning and shooting pain have been reduced to a tiny roar. Do I still have neuropathy? you bet I do. I know it there due to a low level of numbness. But I can feel everything, my feet are warm and pink. They used to be cold, irritated, and I suffered from dry skin in the Winter. Now I dont.  So the neuropathy  seems to be either well controlled, extremely marginalized, or actually getting better... and, yes, I consider it to be a miracle. Ill have 2  60 minute sessions one tomorrow and one on Thursday. I will be walking on air. I want all of you here to be feeling better, able to rest, be pain free, etc. Ill share an article about the use of hyper baric oxygen therapy as soon as I get the link or a copy of the article. Best wishes! Bonny Cooper
comment: Diabetes is not all that easy.

content: My Rheumatologist had given me a prescription for Lidocaine cream but my insurance wouldn't cover it bc they said you can buy it over the counter. They didn't take in consideration the strength. So my great doctor is calling in an ointment instead bc they will pay for that. I personally think an ointment of lidocaine would be even better. So if you come up with the same problem try the ointment instead. Hope this helps you guys.
comment: insurance is a problem for all americans. it's time to fight the real system.

content: Watch this please!  Will help you a lot!
comment: insurance is a dangerous crisis. it's time to fight it.

content: My blood sugar was down to 112 today. Lowest in two years.  Usually in the last mid-2’s. Did it wreak havoc in my body though. Feeling good now but that went down fast.
comment: Low blood sugar can be associated with serious pain.
